instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).

threads.title: 2915 no power on <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> and s0
threads.message: got a 2915 board. no power,  replaced lots of parts so far, was missing pp5v and pp5v sus, brought it back replaced the <TRANSISTOR>Q7802</TRANSISTOR>.  tracking down the <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> and traced it back to the <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> has no power.  I seem to be getting lost trying to track down the power creation for <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> any help is greatly appreciated.

threads.title: 2915 no power on <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> and s0
threads.message: Why lots of parts replaced? Why was <TRANSISTOR>Q7802</TRANSISTOR> dead, does usually not just happen. Liquid damage?

threads.title: 2915 no power on <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> and s0
threads.message: Yes, Sorry should have mentioned that it was very badly liquid damaged. some fried stuff and stuff that did not look good. idk not that much in general just more than normal replaced. pretty toasted board to start with. normally i would just toss it and move on. but i have some extra time and want to keep learning more so taking the time to go through everything here and understand it all better. <TRANSISTOR>Q7802</TRANSISTOR> was dead from bad liquid around that areas along with some other parts on that rail that looked fried.

threads.title: 2915 no power on <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> and s0
threads.message: Well then it could be anything. Corrosion under SMC/PCH etc. Check RTC voltages and 32KHz from clock chip.
